metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18499 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A same-origin policy violation allowing the theft of cross-origin URL entries when using a meta http-equiv="refresh" on a page to cause a redirection to another site using performance.getEntries(). This is a same-origin policy violation and could allow for data theft. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 62, Firefox ESR < 60.2, and Thunderbird < 60.2.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18499` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
